text: This is a list of wars fought by Romania since 1859: == The United Principalities of Moldavia and Wallachia (1859–1862) == The United Principalities of Moldavia and Wallachia did not participate in any wars. == Romanian United Principalities (1862–1866) == The Romanian United Principalities did not participate in any wars. == Principality of Romania (1866–1881) == {| class="wikitable" |- ! 23 July 2009 |style="background:#efefef"|Iraq War |style="background:#efefef"| Iraqi National Congress New Iraqi government * Iraqi Armed Forces * Awakening Council * Peshmerga |style="background:#efefef"| Ba'athist Iraq Ansar al-Islam \---- link= Supreme Command for Jihad and Liberation Army of the Men of the Naqshbandi Order \---- Sunni insurgents * Islamic State of Iraq * link= Islamic Army of Iraq * Ansar al-Sunnah \---- Shia insurgents * Mahdi Army * link= Special Groups * Asa'ib Ahl al-Haq * Others \---- For fighting between insurgent groups, see Civil war in Iraq (2006–07). |style="background:#AF9"|Victory * Invasion and occupation of Iraq *Overthrow of Ba'ath Party government and execution of Saddam Hussein * Iraqi insurgency, emergence of al-Qaeda in Iraq, and civil war * Subsequent depletion of al- Qaeda in Iraq, improvements in public security, Iraqi insurgency persists * Establishment of democratic elections and formation of new Shia led government * U.S.–Iraq Status of Forces Agreement * Escalation of sectarian insurgency after U.S. withdrawal and spillover with the Syrian Civil War * Resurgence of Islamic State of Iraq, the successor of al-Qaeda in Iraq |style="background:#efefef;text-align:center;"|3 soldiers killed. |style="background:#efefef;text-align:center;"|Ion Iliescu (until Dec. 2004) Traian Băsescu (from Dec. 2004) |style="background:#efefef;text- align:center;"|Adrian Năstase (until Dec. 2004) Călin Popescu-Tăriceanu (Dec. 2004-Dec. 2008) Emil Boc (from Dec. 2008) |style="background:#efefef;text-align:center;"|Ioan Mircea Pașcu (until Dec. 2004) Teodor Atanasiu (Dec. 2004-Oct. 2006) Sorin Frunzăverde (Oct. 2006-Apr. 2007) Teodor Meleșcanu (Apr. 2007-Dec. 2008) Mihai Stănișoară (from Dec. 2008) |style="background:#efefef;text- align:center;" rowspan="3"|Mihail Eugen Popescu (until Oct. 2004) Eugen Bădălan (Oct. 2004-Sep. 2006) Gheorghe Marin (from. Sep. 2006) Ștefan Dănilă (from Jan. 2011) Nicolae Ciucă (from Jan. 2015) Daniel Petrescu (from Nov. 2019) |- |style="background:#efefef"|7 October 2001 - Present Day |style="background:#efefef"|War in Afghanistan (2001–present) |style="background:#efefef"| *ISAF *RS |style="background:#efefef"| *Taliban *Al-Qaeda |style="background:#AF9"|Ongoing *Defeat of the Taliban government in Afghanistan and fall of the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan. *Destruction of al-Qaeda camps. *Establishment of new Afghan government and creation of the new Afghan National Army. *Ongoing taliban insurgency. |style="background:#efefef;text-align:center;"|23 soldiers killed. |style="background:#efefef;text-align:center;" rowspan="2"|Ion Iliescu (2001-2004.
